snippet: Randall Grahm believes in transparency in wine production: he listed on every bottle all the ingredients used in producing his wine. Yet nobody seems to notice.
abstract: Eric Asimov The Pour column applauds Randall Grahm, proprietor of Bonny Doon Vineyard in Santa Cruz, Calif, for deciding to list on every bottle all ingredients used in producing his wine; observes that this bold step in favor of consumer transparency mostly went unnoticed.
lead_paragraph: Randall Grahm believes in transparency in wine production: he listed on every bottle all the ingredients used in producing his wine. Yet nobody seems to notice.

headline.print_headline: A Vintner Has Nothing to Hide, but Few Look
headline.seo: Bonny Doon Vineyard’s Labeling Policy Draws Little Attention
headline.main: Vintner With Nothing to Hide Finds That Few Are Looking
